ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Seed has not been processed -- Out of Clues
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, Jay. Some ideas: (1) Update your code. CVS HEAD often has problems, even occasionally fatal problems, but they are also regularly fixed. Your version from

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Seed has not been processed -- Out of Clues
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=wr0eGjE-da3NPwVrl82H3xvw4biWALAIAI5pQ3G7-Xe0

Hi, Jay.

Some ideas:

(1) Update your code. CVS HEAD often has problems, even occasionally
fatal problems, but they are also regularly fixed. Your version from
CVS of months ago could have serious problems... but only if they
persist in current code would they warrant careful investigation.

(2) At a time when all but 1 of the URLs have succeeded, call
up a 'Frontier Report'. What is the status of the queue holding
the problem URL? If it's in a multi-minute 'snooze', the topmost
URL (which may be one of your URL's prerequisites) was tried and
failed and is awaiting retry. The default settings take many
hours to finally give up on an URL, since transient network
problems are common, and once an URL is makred as 'failed',
it is no longer retried.

(3) Look in the 'local-errors.log'. Many transient errors which
do not mark a URI as 'failed for good' appear here. Many resolve
with a later retry, but seeing what sort of error is affecting
the URL(s) which remain unprocessed could help determine what's
happening.

Similarly, you could run a test crawl with very small
Frontier 'max-retries' and 'retry-delay-seconds' settings --
perhaps '4' and '30'. Then, unless the problem is some sort
of long network hang, all URLs should either succeed or fail
within a few minutes -- at least getting you error information
in the 'crawl.log' about everything.

(4) Check to see if a substantially similar URL has been crawled.
For example, if you are having problems with 'http://example.com'
showing as never-crawled, see if 'http://www.example.com' has been
crawled. Our default canonicalization rules will consider these
the same URL in most situations, and until recently (and perhaps
still) certain combinations of URL seed/discovery ordering,
redirections, and scope configuration can inadvertently keep the
'right' variant from being crawled, once the 'wrong' variant
has already marked the URL as done.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

Jay wrote:
> I have been getting this message in the seeds report while the job is
> running.  Like I am crawling only 3 seeds and one of the seeds has
> this message and never got crawled even the job is finished (after 48
> hrs or so).  If I run the job again, sometimes it got crawled
> successfully all three.  And the URL, I am getting is not consistent.
>  I am getting this error on different urls from different job on
> different crawler.  At that same time, if I go to the URL in the
> browser, I have no problem. 
> 
> I am still using the version from CVS head like 3 months ago.  
> 
> I am getting out of clues to debug this since the url who got error
> didn't show up in any log files even crawl.log.  Just only in the
> seeds report.  Can someone pointed me where to go to debug this?
> 
> Thanks,
> Jay
